page.title: 12 Lower Chesham Hall
page.content:
Richard Kay bought Chesham Manor and half the estate in 1709 for Â£480. He built a new house in stone which was better than the existing Tudor style one. Richard's new manor is now a listed building.
The house, known as Lower Chesham Hall, still has mullioned windows, some of which have the original leaded glass in them. The stone on one side is very black because of the smoke from the old mills and factories.
Part of the house is now used as offices but the other part still has people living in it. These people take care not to damage the character of the house.
St. Marks P.S.
